snippet: In remarks to reporters after his national security team met at the Pentagon, the president singled out allies in the region to contribute more in the battle to push back the Islamic State.
abstract: Pres Obama dispatches Defense Sec Ashton B Carter to Middle East in effort to prod Saudi Arabia and other regional allies into more active role in fighting Islamic State; remarks after security team conference express new urgency, possibly tacit response to criticism of pace and scope of president's campaign against terrorist group.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and HELENE COOPER

lead_paragraph: In remarks to reporters after his national security team met at the Pentagon, the president singled out allies in the region to contribute more in the battle to push back the Islamic State.

headline.main: Obama Urges Mideast Allies to Do More in Fight Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: Mideast Allies Urged to Step Up ISIS Fight

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
